div.p: RESERVE in lav/, the fame with yeſervation, See Re SS.K.VAT1ON.

Body of Reserve, or Corps de Reserve, in military affairs, the third or laſt line of an army, drawn up for battle; ſo called becauie they are reſerved to ſuſtain the reſt as occaſton requires, and not to engage but in cafe of neceſſity.
